  • havoc.autoval.tests.lspci_validation.lspci_validation

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.lspci_validation.lspci_validation

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.pci_utils import PciUtils



[docs]class LspciValidation(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(LspciValidation, self).__init__()
        self.args = self.test_control["args"]



[docs]    def execute(self):
        obj = PciUtils().get_lspci_output(
            self.host, options="-vvv", custom_logfile="lspci_vvv.log"
        )
        out = obj.stdout
        self.parse_lspci(out)



[docs]    def parse_lspci(self, lspci_out):
        for dev in self.args["devices"]:
            output = PciUtils().get_lnksta_lnkcap(lspci_out, dev)
            for out in output:
                self.validate_equal(
                    out["cap_speed"],
                    out["sta_speed"],
                    "Validating LnkCap speed matches LnkSta speed for device {}"
                    .format(out["dev_line"]))

                self.validate_equal(
                    out["cap_width"],
                    out["sta_width"],
                    "Validating LnkCap width matches LnkSta width for device {}"
                    .format(out["dev_line"]))




[docs]def main():
    test = LspciValidation()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
